TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LogPolicy extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the policy associated with a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A policy is a set of rules to be followed by a <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> instance and its clients. A <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy> instance is used to examine and modify the policy associated with a specific <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore>. A policy can describe the minimum and maximum allowable log sizes, or how the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> instance is allowed to grow. In addition, you can also control whether a <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> instance can be archived.
After changing any of the properties, you should use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy.Commit%2A> method to ensure that the changes are applied to the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore>. You can call the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy.Refresh%2A> method to discard changes or to get the most current policy.
## Examples This example shows how to use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy> class to set policy for a log record sequence.
[!code-csharp[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/cs/mylogrecordsequence.cs#2)] [!code-vb[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/vb/mylogrecordsequence.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the can grow automatically.
Docs.value: if the can grow its size automatically; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples This example shows how to use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy> class to set policy for a log record sequence.
[!code-csharp[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/cs/mylogrecordsequence.cs#2)] [!code-vb[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/vb/mylogrecordsequence.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of free space the can shrink.
Docs.value: The percentage of free space the can shrink.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the amount of free space in the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> is greater than the amount specified by this property, the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> automatically reduces its size until it reaches the size specified by the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy.MinimumExtentCount%2A> property.
## Examples This example shows how to use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy> class to set policy for a log record sequence.
[!code-csharp[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/cs/mylogrecordsequence.cs#2)] [!code-vb[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/vb/mylogrecordsequence.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Commit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets this policy as the current policy for the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You must call <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy.Commit%2A> after making any changes to ensure that the changes are recorded.
## Examples This example shows how to use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy> class to set policy for a log record sequence.
[!code-csharp[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/cs/mylogrecordsequence.cs#2)] [!code-vb[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/vb/mylogrecordsequence.vb#2)]

Docs.exception:
The set of policies installed on the log is invalid.
-or-
A policy of the log prevented this operation from completing.
The request could not be performed because of an unexpected I/O exception.
Setting this policy is not supported on the current platform.
The method was called after the sequence has been disposed of.
There is not enough memory to continue the execution of the program.
The new extent prefix is invalid or too long. A valid prefix must be provided.
Access for the specified log store is denied by the operating system.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the rate of automatic growth of the .
Docs.value: The rate of automatic growth of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> becomes full, this policy value determines how much more space can be added. Space will not be added if it causes the number of extents in the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> to exceed <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy.MaximumExtentCount%2A>.
## Examples This example shows how to use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy> class to set policy for a log record sequence.
[!code-csharp[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/cs/mylogrecordsequence.cs#2)] [!code-vb[S_UELogRecordSequence#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/vb/mylogrecordsequence.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of instances the can contain.
Docs.value: The maximum number of instances the can contain.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of instances the can contain.
Docs.value: An integer that specifies the minimum number of instances the can contain. Since the CLFS requires that the minimum extent count to be 2 extents, this value should be at least 2.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the prefix string for automatically created extents.
Docs.value: The prefix string for automatically created extents.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This string can contain a full path to the directory where the new extent is created. The default path to the extent is the directory that contains the base <xref:System.IO.Log.LogStore> file.
## Examples This example shows how to use the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogPolicy> class to set policy for a log record sequence.

Docs.value: The suffix number for new extents.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space that the event requires for advancing the base of the log.
Docs.value: The amount of space that the event requires for advancing the base of the log.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The amount of space can be expressed in percentage, or in bytes which is rounded off to the nearest containers in CLFS. The default is 35 percent.
